page.title: 17Black Butter Making, St.John
page.content:
Black Butter, a kind of preserve, is made mainly with apples. The {ingredients}are{cider apples, sugar, and{liquorice.}Other{spices}are added to individual preference.
Black Butter was very popular in years gone by, but is made nowadays as a rare{social occasion.
Black Butter is made near apple harvest time by peeling and cutting up many apples, and placing them in a {"bachin",}(a large brass bowl) containing the boiling cider to be cooked. This mixture is stirred for at least twenty-four hours and then put into jars.
When I tried Black Butter, I did not like it though many folk do.
